14295.name: Understand and use numbers in context
14295.text: demonstrate concepts of counting using every day experiences

14294.name: Estimate and calculate
14294.text: recognise the effects of adding to and taking away from a collection of objects

14291.name: Use money
14291.text: identify situations that involve the use of money

14309.name: Understand and use numbers in context
14309.text: connect and order number names, numerals and groups of objects using numbers up to two digits

14302.name: Estimate and calculate
14302.text: solve everyday addition and share stories

14306.name: Use money
14306.text: recognise the different value of coins and notes in the Australian monetary system

14317.name: Understand and use numbers in context
14317.text: model, represent, order and use numbers up to four digits

14316.name: Estimate and calculate
14316.text: estimate the solution to a problem and then calculate the answer

14319.name: Use money
14319.text: identify and use combinations of coins and notes for simple purchases

14326.name: Understand and use numbers in context
14326.text: model, represent, order and use numbers up to five digits

14331.name: Estimate and calculate
14331.text: estimate a solution to a problem and then check the solution by recalling addition, subtraction, multiplication and division facts

14325.name: Use money
14325.text: estimate the change from simple purchases

14345.name: Understand and use numbers in context
14345.text: identify, describe and use numbers larger than one million

14343.name: Estimate and calculate
14343.text: solve problems and check calculations using efficient mental and written strategies

14344.name: Use money
14344.text: create simple financial plans, budgets and cost predictions

14349.name: Understand and use numbers in context
14349.text: compare, order and use positive and negative numbers to solve everyday problems

14358.name: Estimate and calculate
14358.text: solve complex problems by estimating and calculating using efficient mental, written and digital strategies

14356.name: Use money
14356.text: identify and justify ‘best value for money’ decisions

14362.name: Understand and use numbers in context
14362.text: use different ways to represent very large and very small numbers including scientific notation

14360.name: Estimate and calculate
14360.text: solve and model problems involving complex data by estimating and calculating using a variety of efficient mental, written and digital strategies

14363.name: Use money
14363.text: evaluate financial plans to support specific financial goals

14297.name: Recognise and use patterns and relationships
14297.text: recognise simple patterns in everyday contexts

14300.name: Recognise and use patterns and relationships

14321.name: Recognise and use patterns and relationships
14321.text: identify, describe and create everyday patterns

14334.name: Recognise and use patterns and relationships
14334.text: identify and describe trends in everyday patterns

14335.name: Recognise and use patterns and relationships
14335.text: identify and describe pattern rules and relationships that help to identify trends

14354.name: Recognise and use patterns and relationships
14354.text: identify trends using number rules and relationships

14370.name: Recognise and use patterns and relationships
14370.text: explain how the practical application of patterns can be used to identify trends

14293.name: Interpret proportional reasoning
14293.text: recognise a ‘whole’ and ‘parts of a whole’ within everyday contexts

14288.name: Apply proportional reasoning
14288.text: Level 1b is the starting point for this sub-element

14308.name: Interpret proportional reasoning
14308.text: recognise that a whole object can be divided into equal parts

14301.name: Apply proportional reasoning
14301.text: identify quantities such as more, less and the same in everyday comparisons

14312.name: Interpret proportional reasoning
14312.text: visualise and describe halves and quarters

14315.name: Apply proportional reasoning
14315.text: solve problems using halves and quarters

14329.name: Interpret proportional reasoning
14329.text: visualise, describe and order tenths, hundredths, 1-place and 2-place decimals

14323.name: Apply proportional reasoning
14323.text: solve problems using equivalent fractions for tenths, hundredths, 1-place and 2-place decimals

14341.name: Interpret proportional reasoning
14341.text: visualise, describe and order equivalent fractions, decimals and simple percentages

14340.name: Apply proportional reasoning
14340.text: solve problems using equivalent fractions, decimals and simple percentages

14353.name: Interpret proportional reasoning
14353.text: visualise and describe the proportions of percentages, ratios and rates

14355.name: Apply proportional reasoning
14355.text: solve problems using simple percentages, ratios and rates

14366.name: Interpret proportional reasoning
14366.text: illustrate and order relationships for fractions, decimals, percentages, ratios and rates

14369.name: Apply proportional reasoning
14369.text: solve problems involving fractions, decimals, percentages, ratios and rates

14287.name: Visualise 2D shapes and 3D objects
14287.text: sort or match objects according to their features

14298.name: Interpret maps and diagrams
14298.text: demonstrate awareness of position of self and objects in relation to everyday contexts

14299.name: Visualise 2D shapes and 3D objects
14299.text: sort and name simple 2D shapes and 3D objects

14307.name: Interpret maps and diagrams
14307.text: follow directions to demonstrate understanding of common position words and movements

14320.name: Visualise 2D shapes and 3D objects
14320.text: identify, sort and describe common 2D shapes and 3D objects

14311.name: Interpret maps and diagrams
14311.text: give and follow directions on maps and diagrams of familiar locations

14330.name: Visualise 2D shapes and 3D objects
14330.text: visualise, sort, identify and describe symmetry, shapes and angles in the environment

14328.name: Interpret maps and diagrams
14328.text: interpret information, locate positions and describe routes on maps and diagrams using simple scales, legends and directional language

14338.name: Visualise 2D shapes and 3D objects
14338.text: visualise, sort, describe and compare the features of objects such as prisms and pyramids in the environment

14337.name: Interpret maps and diagrams
14337.text: identify and describe routes and locations, using grid reference systems and directional language such as north or north east

14347.name: Visualise 2D shapes and 3D objects
14347.text: visualise, describe and apply their understanding of the features and properties of 2D shapes and 3D objects

14352.name: Interpret maps and diagrams
14352.text: create and interpret 2D and 3D maps, models and diagrams

14361.name: Visualise 2D shapes and 3D objects
14361.text: visualise, describe and analyse the way shapes and objects are combined and positioned in the environment for different purposes

14365.name: Interpret maps and diagrams
14365.text: create and interpret maps, models and diagrams using a range of mapping tools

14289.name: Interpret data displays
14289.text: display information using real objects or photographs and respond to questions about the information displayed

14292.name: Interpret chance events
14292.text: Level 1b is the starting point for this sub-element

14305.name: Interpret data displays
14305.text: recognise how to ask and answer simple data questions and interpret data in drawings or picture graphs

14303.name: Interpret chance events
14303.text: recognise that some events might or might not happen

14318.name: Interpret data displays
14318.text: collect and describe data on a relevant issue based on one variable and display as lists, tables or picture graphs

14322.name: Interpret chance events
14322.text: identify and describe familiar events that involve chance

14333.name: Interpret data displays
14333.text: collect record and display data as tables, diagrams, picture graphs and column graphs

14332.name: Interpret chance events
14332.text: describe possible outcomes from chance experiments using informal chance language and recognising variations in results

14339.name: Interpret data displays
14339.text: collect, compare, describe and interpret data as 2-way tables, double column graphs and sector graphs, including from digital media

14336.name: Interpret chance events
14336.text: describe chance events and compare observed outcomes with predictions using numerical representations such as a 75% chance of rain or 50/50 chance of snow

14348.name: Interpret data displays
14348.text: compare, interpret and assess the effectiveness of different data displays of the same information

14357.name: Interpret chance events
14357.text: describe and explain why the actual results of chance events are not always the same as expected results

14359.name: Interpret data displays
14359.text: evaluate media statistics and trends by linking claims to data displays, statistics and representative data

14368.name: Interpret chance events
14368.text: explain the likelihood of multiple events occurring together by giving examples of situations when they might happen

14296.name: Estimate and measure with metric units
14296.text: use informal language and/or actions to describe characteristics of length, temperature, mass, volume, capacity and area in familiar environments

14290.name: Operate with clocks calendars and timetables
14290.text: sequence familiar actions and events in a variety of ways

14310.name: Estimate and measure with metric units
14310.text: measure by comparing objects and indicate if these measurements are the same or different

14304.name: Operate with clocks calendars and timetables
14304.text: sequence familiar actions and events using the everyday language of time

14314.name: Estimate and measure with metric units
14314.text: estimate, measure and order using direct and indirect comparisons and informal units to collect and record information about shapes and objects

14313.name: Operate with clocks calendars and timetables
14313.text: read digital and analogue clocks to the half and quarter hour, sequence events by months and seasons and identify a date on a calendar

14324.name: Estimate and measure with metric units
14324.text: estimate, measure and compare the length, temperature, volume, capacity and mass of everyday objects using metric units and scaled instruments

14327.name: Operate with clocks calendars and timetables
14327.text: read digital and analogue clocks to the minute, convert between hours and minutes, use 'am' and 'pm', and use calendars to locate and compare time events

14346.name: Estimate and measure with metric units
14346.text: choose and use appropriate metric units for length, area, volume, capacity and mass to solve everyday problems

14342.name: Operate with clocks calendars and timetables
14342.text: convert between 12- and 24-hour systems to solve time problems, interpret and use timetables from print and digital sources

14350.name: Estimate and measure with metric units
14350.text: convert between common metric units for volume and capacity and use perimeter, area and volume formulas to solve authentic problems

14351.name: Operate with clocks calendars and timetables
14351.text: use 12- and 24-hour systems within a single time zone to solve time problems, and place personal and family events on an extended time scale

14364.name: Estimate and measure with metric units
14364.text: solve complex problems involving surface area and volume of prisms and cylinders and composite solids

14367.name: Operate with clocks calendars and timetables
14367.text: use 12- and 24-hour systems within a multiple time zone to solve time problems, use large and small timescales in complex contexts and place historical and scientific events on an extended time scale
